entities.creatures.mobs

Class Mob

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.Entity
      • entities.creatures.Creature
        • entities.creatures.mobs.Mob
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Interactable, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Goblin, MoltenCorki, Rat, Skeleton

    public abstract class Mob
extends Creature
implements java.io.Serializable, Interactable
    A Mob is a Creature that will pursue and attack the Player if "aggroed", or will roam about if not.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mob

        public Mob(java.lang.String name,
           java.lang.String examineText,
           float x,
           float y,
           boolean canShareTile,
           int startingHealth,
           int attackDamage,
           float speed,
           boolean isAggroed)
        Creates a new Mob with the specified information.
        Parameters:
        name - The Mob's name.
        examineText - This Mob's examination text.
        x - The x component of this Mob's location.
        y - The y component of this Mob's location.
        canShareTile - Whether this Mob can share their tile with another Entity.
        startingHealth - This Mob's maximum health.
        attackDamage - The amount of damage this Mob deals when attacking.
        speed - This Mob's movement speed.
        isAggroed - Whether this Mob actively pursues and attacks the player on sight or not.

    • Method Detail

      • distanceToPlayer

        private float distanceToPlayer()

      • dropItem

        public abstract Item dropItem()
        Mobs can drop Items when they are killed. Each Mob will specify its own behavior for dropping Items on death.
        Returns:
        An Item for the player to keep or null if no item is dropped.

      • isAggroed

        public boolean isAggroed()

      • moveToPlayer

        private void moveToPlayer()
        Makes this Mob move towards the Player. Called by aggroed Mobs. They will engage in combat with the Player if they make contact with them.

      • readObject

        private void readObject(java.io.ObjectInputStream in)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Un-serializes this object following default behavior.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading from the Stream.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If an invalid class was read from the Stream.
